title: layer-by-layer profiling feature
body_html:
Our team is working on the PyTorch performance(DeepSpeech2 first) optimization for IA platform. We first use the default profiler in pytorch, and found that this profiler is a low level(functional) profiler. We tried the CProfile, but still we could not get a layer-by-layer result.
It would be great for PyTorch to provide a layer-by-layer profiler, just like caffe time.
And this layer-by-layer profiler will be very useful for the performance tuning, and model level perception.
body_text:
Our team is working on the PyTorch performance(DeepSpeech2 first) optimization for IA platform. We first use the default profiler in pytorch, and found that this profiler is a low level(functional) profiler. We tried the CProfile, but still we could not get a layer-by-layer result.
It would be great for PyTorch to provide a layer-by-layer profiler, just like caffe time.
And this layer-by-layer profiler will be very useful for the performance tuning, and model level perception.
body:
Our team is working on the PyTorch performance(DeepSpeech2 first) optimization for IA platform. We first use the default [profiler](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/torch/autograd/profiler.py) in pytorch, and found that this profiler is a low level(functional) profiler. We tried the CProfile, but still we could not get a layer-by-layer result.
It would be great for PyTorch to provide a layer-by-layer profiler, just like caffe time.
And this layer-by-layer profiler will be very useful for the performance tuning, and model level perception.
